text: Outside the door, standing in the dimness of the landing, I found M.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: d'Agen. At any other time I should have been the first to ask him why he
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: had left the post which I had assigned to him. But at the moment I was
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: off my balance, and his presence suggested nothing more than that here
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was the very person who could best execute my wishes. I held out the key
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: to him at arms length, and bade him release Mademoiselle de la Vire, who
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was in the room above, and escort her out of the castle. 'Do not let
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: her linger here,' I continued urgently. 'Take her to the place where we
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: found the wood-cutters. You need fear no resistance.'
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'But Bruhl?' he said, as he took the key mechanically from me.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'He is out of the question,' I answered in a low voice. 'We have done
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: with him. He has the plague.'
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He uttered a sharp exclamation. 'What of madame, then?' he muttered.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'She is with him,' I said.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: He cried out suddenly at that, sucking in his breath, as I have known
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: men do in pain. And but that I drew back he would have laid his hand on
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: my sleeve. 'With him?' he stammered. 'How is that?'
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: 'Why, man, where else should she be?' I answered, forgetting that the
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: sight of those two together had at first surprised me also, as well as
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: moved me. 'Or who else should be with him? He is her husband.'
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and began to go up; while I looked after him, gradually thinking out the
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: clue to his conduct. Could it be that it was not mademoiselle attracted
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: him, but Madame de Bruhl?
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: And with that hint I understood it all. I saw in a moment; the
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: conclusion to which he had come on hearing of the presence of madame
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: in my room. In my room at night! The change had dated from that time;
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: instead of a careless, light-spirited youth he had become in a moment
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a morose and restive churl, as difficult to manage as an unbroken colt.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Quite clearly I saw now the meaning of the change; why he had shrunk
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: from me, and why all intercourse between us had been so difficult; and
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: so constrained.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: I laughed to think how he had deceived himself, and how nearly I had
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: come to deceiving myself also. And what more I might have thought I
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: do not know, for my meditations were cut short at this point by a loud
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: outcry below, which, beginning in one or two sharp cries of alarm and
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: warning, culminated quickly in a roar of anger and dismay.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Fancying I recognised Maignan's voice, I ran down the stairs, seeking
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: a loophole whence I could command the scene; but finding none, and
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: becoming more and more alarmed, I descended to the court, which I
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: found, to my great surprise, as empty and silent as an old battle-field.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Neither on the enemy's side nor on ours was a single man to be seen.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: With growing dismay I sprang across the court and darted through the
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: outer tower, only to find that and the gateway equally unguarded. Nor
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: was it until I had passed through the latter, and stood on the brow of
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the slope, which we had had to clamber with so much toil, that I learned
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: what was amiss.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Far below me a string of men, bounding and running at speed, streamed
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: down the hill towards the horses. Some were shouting, some running
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: silently, with their elbows at their sides and their scabbards leaping
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: against their calves. The horses stood tethered in a ring near the edge
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the wood, and by some oversight had been left unguarded. The foremost
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: runner I made out to be Fresnoy; but a number of his men were close
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: upon him, and then after an interval came Maignan, waving his blade and
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: emitting frantic threats with every stride. Comprehending at once
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: that Fresnoy and his following, rendered desperate by panic and the
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: prospective loss of their horses, had taken advantage of my absence and
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: given Maignan the slip, I saw I could do nothing save watch the result
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: of the struggle.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: This was not long delayed. Maignan's threats, which seemed to me mere
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: waste of breath, were not without effect on those he followed. There
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: is nothing which demoralises men like flight. Troopers who have stood
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: charge after charge while victory was possible will fly like sheep, and
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: like sheep allow themselves to be butchered, when they have once turned
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the back. So it was here. Many of Fresnoy's men were stout fellows,
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: but having started to run they had no stomach for fighting. Their fears
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: caused Maignan to appear near, while the horses seemed distant; and one
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: after another they turned aside and made like rabbits for the wood.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: Only Fresnoy, who had taken care to have the start of all, kept on,
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and, reaching the horses, cut the rope which tethered the nearest, and
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: vaulted nimbly on its back. Safely seated there, he tried to frighten
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the others into breaking loose; but not succeeding at the first attempt,
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: and seeing Maignan, breathing vengeance, coming up with him, he started
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: his horse, a bright bay, and rode off laughing along the edge of the
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: wood.
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: us very dearly--I was about to turn away when I saw that Maignan had
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: mounted and was preparing to follow. I stayed accordingly to see the
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: end, and from my elevated position enjoyed a first-rate view of the race
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: ground. But when a couple of hundred yards had been covered Fresnoy had
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: the ill-luck to blunder into some heavy ground, and this enabling his
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: pursuer, who had time to avoid it, to get within two-score paces of him,
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: over.

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: gazing on the scene with increased interest, I saw Maignan, who had
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: dismounted, stoop over something on the ground, and again after an
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: me; how heartlessly he had abandoned Matthew, its owner; and by what
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

text: since leaving Blois, was torn and stained with mud. Her hair was in
title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac

author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John

title: A Gentleman of France: Being the Memoirs of Gaston de Bonne Sieur de Marsac
author: Weyman, Stanley John

author: Weyman, Stanley John
